Legal_Issue: Whether the RPD's decision to deny Mr. Cheema refugee status was reasonable based on credibility, state protection, and internal flight alternatives
Application_Facts: Mr. Cheema claimed refugee status due to fear of persecution from Sunni extremists in Pakistan
Decision_Outcome: The RPD's decision was reasonable; application for judicial review dismissed
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the RPD's decision
Court_Ruling: Federal Court upheld the RPD's decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution by Sunni extremists in Pakistan
Assessment_Factor: Credibility, availability of state protection, internal flight alternative
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review following RPD's rejection of refugee claim
Evidence_Assessed: Personal testimony, documentary evidence (or lack thereof)
Relief_Sought: Granting of refugee status, successful judicial review
Governing_Rule: Federal Court reviews RPD decisions for reasonableness
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of evidence to support claims of inaccessible state protection or unsafe internal flight options
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution in Pakistan not sufficiently established
Cause_Description: Mr. Cheema feared persecution from Sunni extremists in Pakistan due to his religious beliefs
Evidence_Handling: RPD assessed credibility and found inconsistencies
Evidence_Issues: Inconsistent testimony, lack of corroborating evidence
Evidence_Assessment: Negative credibility finding due to inconsistencies and lack of evidence
Decision_Rationale: Mr. Cheema failed to demonstrate lack of state protection or viable internal flight alternative; credibility concerns
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence to support key elements of the claim
